reporting-org.narrative: UTZ - joined forces with Rainforest Alliance

title.narrative: Building capacities for sector change: Central America program

description.narrative: In 2020 we will have strengthened the lobby and advocacy capacity of civil society organizations in Central America on productivity, Climate and water and living wage. As a result we will see an improvement of policy environment (both government and companies) and support services in these countries related to these themes.These themes are: 1. Sustainable productivity Raising smallholder productivity in a sustainable way is a key component of sector transformation. It is needed to increase income of the farmer and increase production while lowering the environmental footprint. 2. Women’s empowerment and gender The goal is to increase the inclusion of women in certification and access to benefits as well as to reduce discrimination and violence against women. 3. Climate and water The focus is on up scaling of best practices in smallholder adaptation to climate change and sustainable water use. 4. Living wage The goal is to improve wages of workers on coffee and tea estates towards a living wage.
SP-CEAM Building capacities for sector change: Central America program

title.narrative: Country Scan

description.narrative: During the first part of the inception phase of the program (December 2015-March 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff, carried out a deeper analysis of the sector(s) and themes proposed for their countries to develop a more focused approach for the SP program. The objective of the Country Scans was “to provide a situational analysis on each sector and theme per country assessing the current state with regards to the relevant thematic SP objectives, clearly formulating the causes of the problem that need addressing and identify opportunities for interventions and provide recommendations on potential partners for these interventions.” The Country Scan documents are based on our own experience in the countries, but also document review, conversations/interviews with experts, key informants including Dutch embassy staff, national and international organizations, and workshop results with many of these actors.

title.narrative: # of country scans

comment.narrative: 1 regional scan is completed (including Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua)
10-01-2018: 1 regional scan completed (including Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua)

title.narrative: Country Plan

description.narrative: During the second part of the inception phase of the program (April-July 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff in drafting the country plans. The purpose of the SP country program plan is to set out a strategic direction for sector change in the country and serves as a framework. This plan clearly states UTZ goals for the country the Theory of Change to guide interventions as well as the budget for said activities. Overall, the SP Country Plan will serve as a guide for the next years, as well as a basis for the year plans that will be formulated for 2017 to 2020.

title.narrative: # of country plans

comment.narrative: 1 regional plan is completed (including Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua)
10-01-2018: 1 regional plan completed (including Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua)

title.narrative: Ultimate Outcome 1: Improved inclusion of the voice of female and male smallholders and workers

description.narrative: Improved inclusion of the voice of female and male smallholders and workers in policy/law-making processes

title.narrative: DD3 # of more inclusive policy/law-making processes

description.narrative: Voices, needs and interests of male and female farmers, smallholders and workers are better included in the development of policies and services

comment.narrative: 29-04-2019: our partner Amuhcafe joined the coffee platform in Honduras, representing women in coffee

29-04-2020: 1) Cafenica/Flores del Café Movement: As a result of the project implementation CAFENICA has more women representation in their member organizations. Integration of women in the management bodies of organizations 2) AMUCAFE is involved in the gender policy for the coffee sector. They are participating in every meeting and they gather input from stakeholders. AMUCAFE now is a reference organization in the coffee sector in Honduras 3) AHPROCAFE strengthened its union structures: rural, local and departmental boards, coffee cooperatives. With the participation of new rural, local and departmental managers, at the national level. Ahprocafe is open for gender inclusiveness. 4&5)The new curricula in the National Coffee School and the leadership school with Ahprocafe offer more opportunities for youth and gender inclusion

title.narrative: DD2 # of policy changes that UTZ /partners contributed to

description.narrative: Policies are better in line with the needs of (female) smallholders, (female) farmers and (female) farm workers, based on their needs and interests

comment.narrative: 29-04-2019: INATEC approved the curriculum developed by ENACAFÉ, aimed at developing the coffee sector Ministries and Civil Society stakeholders (ASOREMA) included coffee in priority agriculture themes in the National Plan of adaptation to Climate change. (fundaeco)

29-04-2020: ANACAFE: Changed the technical assistance model for monitoring pests and diseases; (now seeking to prevent new epidemics and not only reacting to them) &included it in their strategic plan

title.narrative: Pathway 2: Research and pilots to create evidence for L&A

description.narrative: Research and pilots with relevant stakeholders to create evidence and best practices to L&A for policy changes

title.narrative: # of research pilots and studies funded

description.narrative: Activities to create new knowledge/evidence are implemented

comment.narrative: 10-01-2018: Including: - Natural Fertilizer - Building up the business case for efficient fertilization and soil conservation with coffee farmers - Honduras [Theme: Climate change] - Addressing climate variability through smallholder coffee decision making tools, gender protagonism, collective learning initiatives and advocacy channels [Theme: Climate change] - Support to Guatemalan coffee producers’ adaptation and mitigation of climate change [Theme: Climate change]

29-04-2019: Coffee Sector National Diagnosis. Nicaragua Coffee Legal Framework Analisis. Nicaragua Coffee Stakeholders Mapping. Nicaragua Educational Vocational Coffee School Services Analisis. Nicaragua Coffee Curricula Development. Nicaragua Soil microbiology lab implementation. Guatemala Child Labor Analisis. Honduras

29-04-2020: 1) National Coffee Strategy commisioned by NICAFES 2) Living wage and Cost of Production Study commisioned by FUNIDES 3) Coffee Curricula Developed commisioned by FUNICA 4) Early warning system study commisioned by ANACAFE

title.narrative: Ultimate Outcome 3: Improvement of services

description.narrative: Services are better in line with the needs of female and male farmers, smallholders and workers; increased funding for services

title.narrative: DD1 # of new or improved government/company programs & services with budget allocation that are targeted and tailored to the needs of female and male smallholders and workers (related to the theme)

description.narrative: Services are better in line with the needs of (female) smallholders, (female) farmers and (female) farm workers, based on their needs and interests; increased funding for services

comment.narrative: Target value for this period has not been defined yet.

18-07-2019: 1. INATEC has committed human and finacial resources to the national coffee school. Rural youths, children of producers, have been included in technical courses of ENACAFÉ (Funica) 2. Agriculture extension agencies in the departments of Alta Verapaz, Baja Verapaz and El Progreso are serviced by extention agents who participate in the SIDEM training process. (fundasystemas) 3. Technical Teams (promoters, technical staff) of the organizations associated with Cafenica apply new agroclimatic knowledge in productive practices of coffee growing.Women and youths are included in data collection through the use of IT.

29-04-2020: 1) INATEC is requesting more support from Funica; Funica will start implementing the new curricula in the coffee schools this year. 2) MAGA and Fedecocagua have accepted the implementation of the SIDEM methodology of Fundasistemas. MAGA signed a permanent extension assistance contract that required the inclusion of eight new extensionists to the process. These extensiomnists are implmenting the methodology. The leadership of 20 producer organizations is implementing it. 3) Staff of Cafenica member organizations: governing bodies, management team, technical teams and members of the promotion network continue to apply new agroclimatic knowledge in their training 4) ANACAFE: Technicians changed the way to provide technical assistance for monitoring pests and diseases. Technical recommendations are now made based on data collected by producers through the coffe cloud mobile app.

title.narrative: Baseline Report

description.narrative: The baseline provides an elaborate context-analysis per country, containing details about capacity of partners and the current state regarding the thematic goals for L&A. The baseline focuses on three main areas: a. Description of baseline situation of context and stakeholders b. Baseline of outcomes of ToC c. Capacities assessment

title.narrative: # of baseline reports

comment.narrative: 1 baseline is completed for the region (including Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua)
10-01-2018: 1 baseline completed for the region (including Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua)
